flawed_nl_solution:
He needs 48 pounds of flour because 12 x 4 = <<12*4=48>>48
He needs 48.0 bags of 10 pound bags because 48 / 10 = <<48/10=48.0>>48.0
He therefore needs to buy 48 bags of flour because 48 < 48.0 < 48
He spends $480 if he buys this flour because 48 x 10 = <<48*10=480>>480
He needs 4.0 bags of the 12-pound flour because 48 / 12 = <<48/12=4.0>>4.0
He would spend $52.0 on the 12-pound bags because 4.0 x 13 = 52.0
He spends $52.0 if he buys the cheapest flour because 480 < 52.0

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 4.8, not 48.0. It appears the decimal point was misplaced.
